books.title: Hester
books.author: Margaret Oliphant
books.summary: The daughter of a failed banker is drawn into conflict with her father’s cousin who saved the bank.

books.title: Room 13
books.author: Edgar Wallace
books.summary: A recently-released prisoner discovers that his love, the daughter of an old friend, has married a sinister imposter.

books.title: The Autobiography of Benjamin Franklin
books.author: Benjamin Franklin
books.summary: Benjamin Franklin writes about his youth, adventures, and achievements.

books.title: Queen Victoria
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: A sardonic and generally unflattering biography of Victoria Alexandrina, Queen of England.

books.title: The Gold Bat
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: The boys of Wrykyn School battle to defend their honor against rival sports teams and enemies from within.

books.title: Indiscretions of Archie
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: When Englishman Archie Moffam makes a complaint about his room to the owner of the New York hotel, his life is changed forever.

books.title: Richard III
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: King Edward IV’s brother, Richard of Gloucester, ascends to the English throne through deadly machinations.

books.title: Five Children and It
books.author: E. Nesbit
books.summary: Five children encounter an ancient magical creature who grants them wishes—all of which go comically wrong.

books.title: Letters of Two Brides
books.author: Honoré de Balzac
books.summary: Two women write letters to tell each other about their lives and loves.

books.title: The Case of Charles Dexter Ward
books.author: H. P. Lovecraft
books.summary: A young scholar delves into his family past and finds more than he bargained for.

books.title: Running a Thousand Miles for Freedom
books.author: William Craft
books.summary: The authors escape from slavery by posing as a slaveowner and his slave.

books.title: The Murder on the Links
books.author: Agatha Christie
books.summary: A famous Belgian detective and his sidekick are summoned to France to investigate the mysterious murder of a rich businessman.

books.title: The Origin of Species
books.author: Charles Darwin
books.summary: A distinguished amateur scientist lays out the evidence for the origin of species by means of natural selection.

books.title: Principia Ethica
books.author: G. E. Moore
books.summary: An analysis of the concept of good that diagnoses the history of ethics as being marred by the “naturalistic fallacy” while discussing intrinsic goods and evils.

books.title: Verses on Various Occasions
books.author: John Henry Newman
books.summary: A collection of poems by John Henry Newman.

books.title: Penguin Island
books.author: Anatole France
books.summary: A myopic saint mistakenly baptizes some penguins, ushering in a centuries-spanning satire of French history.

books.title: Omega
books.author: Camille Flammarion
books.summary: A comet threatens to collide with the Earth, perhaps bringing about the end of the world.

books.title: The Confessions of Arsène Lupin
books.author: Maurice Leblanc
books.summary: The gentleman-thief relates stories of his outwitting the Parisian detectives.

books.title: The Story of My Experiments with Truth
books.author: Mahatma Gandhi
books.summary: Gandhi relates his life experiences from his birth in Gujarat in 1869 through the Indian National Congress of 1915.

books.title: The Cruise of the Alerte
books.author: E. F. Knight
books.summary: An English journalist sets sail in search of treasure buried on a remote desert island.
